title: Riot doesn't care about what you think about Game Balance
body:
EDIT: This is exactly what I'm saying. You can't go a couple posts on these boards without people bringing up Lee Sin again. I'm going to be honest here, Lee Sin isn't as big a problem as he was. I don't know how hard he's crushing things in bronze/silver/gold/idk but he's not worth being discussed this often.

When people see "Gameplay and Balance", they assume that it's a place to go and talk about game balance, like the name insinuates. However, this isn't the entire case.

This section is basically "the Place People Come to Cry About Game Imbalance." There's no point in posting here unless you just want to bolster each other's beliefs that some champions are just completely unbeatable and that Riot's balance team undoubtedly consists of 7 disabled monkeys because they're so bad at their job.

Really though, Riot doesn't care at all about your insight on game balance. They have an entire team of people dedicated to adjusting the game and studying the game to see how they should handle things. Some things they do aren't the best choice of action, but they don't care. They're not going to seriously take the opinion from some random person on their forums that has some people agreeing with them.

I'm not saying that all of you are dumb. Most of you say some things that are pretty stupid but some of you make good suggestions and start reasonable discussion. But Riot doesn't care and this is just the place they created so people can vent their anger about a champion so they don't have to hear it.

I mean, it's obvious from just a glance that the people here strictly believe that Lee Sin is insanely broken and is impossible to beat but you guys haven't changed anything by making a 1000 threads about this champion, so just quit it. I've been here three days and already I believe 95% of you don't even have the game knowledge to contribute anything meaningful to any kind of discussion. It's not even surprising that Riot tends to avoid and ignore this section of the boards.

replies.body: More than that, I think this was the place of hope where people thought that Riot was offering them a place where they could talk with them. But that hope shattered a long time ago.

This. 

OP says they've only been here 3 days, which means they don't know that *once upon a time*, back before Riot hit it big, they *did* care. They *did* value their community. They *were* open about game balance and design directions, and *did* value community input.

Nowadays, we either get political-levels of avoiding-the-issue talks, "you guys are wrong and I'm right because my name has Riot in front of it", or straight refusal to talk at all.

Honestly, that's fine: I don't pretend they're my buddies, and I don't pretend they *have* to care. The thing that pisses me off to no end is that we still hear that they're "community focused" or "care about our feedback" or all the other sugar-worded PR bullshit that's very obviously not the case, at least not any more.

Now, please bear with me for this next bit even if you don't agree about his balance state, I'm *NOT* trying to turn this into a "Lee Sin OP" post, but it's one of the best reference scenarios I have to portray the situation:
Lee Sin has been an overloaded, overpowered champion almost since his release. People have been complaining about how Riot *very* obviously favors him and avoids ever changing him *almost the entire time he's been in the game*, and many people believe it's simply because he's a flashy moneymaker for twitchTV views (which honestly I'm starting to believe with time). Granted, he's a (relatively) old champion, but people have been saying for *over 3 years now* "Riot, Lee Sin is stifling the jungle, has an insanely overloaded kit, and is absolutely infuriating to play against". Every once in awhile the frustration comes to a head where the community just gets goddamn ***FED UP*** with the avoidance/favoritism bullshit for a single jungler, and we get a wave of "Jesus christ is the balance team a bunch of blind morons??!?" threads for 3 months straight.

Now personally, I really don't think anyone with a head on their shoulders deludes themselves anymore that Lee Sin seriously needs some overhauling, as a play rate literally 4x higher than any other jungler and a stranglehold on a place in the top 3 powerful, consistent junglers is indicative of a problem, but Riot doesn't give a shit. There've been other games that have had *glaringly* obvious balance issues, but not ones that both A) profess to care about community feedback and B) Actually acted like they did, back before they became "big".  That's the issue, and why people complain on boards that Riot have long since decided they don't *actually* treat seriously (let's be honest Riot, you can't even PRETEND you take your community seriously when your posterboy jungler "magically" happens to avoid changes despite community complaint for *3+ years*). Once upon a time, Riot was really gung-ho about the whole "the players are important to us" thing, and many "older" players remember that time and still think "maybe deep down that company I supported still exists" (I don't think it does). 

Personally, I think it stopped around he end of Season 2, when they realized "oh shit we've got something with a lot of potential here" since IMO League was kinda the pioneer flagship of E-sports (it's easily the biggest), but it's a pretty fuzzy line to determine. 

TLDR: Riot ***did*** used to care. It's been a long-ass time since they stepped down from their throne and acknowledged they might *not* know more than literally everyone else playing their game 100% of the time, and many players are having a really hard time adjusting to the fact that Riot doesn't give two shits about what their players think unless it involves their wallets these days (note that we still see community input affect skins, yet nothing else... hmm.... :D). Just one veteran players viewpoint of the situation, but hey, I'm 99% sure there's a fuckload of other vets who feel the exact same way.

Trust me I've been on the original forums for a long, long time. I left as soon as the old forums got shut down and Riot made the transition to boards. I know Riot used to respond from time to time but you can't really blame them. The community base is massive.

I made this post as more of a message to the people here rather than to Riot. By here, I mean on the Boards. I see far too many posts that are just blatant complaints and rants after they just got fresh out of a ranked game vs Lee sin. It's polluting this entire section and it's impossible to enter a populated discussion here without someone bringing up Lee Sin avoiding nerfs and such.

Like I said before, I don't think we can blame Riot. Riot has created a huge game with a huge playerbase. Some of that playerbase comes to these boards to complain about a champion in a repetitive, unproductive fashion. Why would Riot listen to some random people arguing like animals on their little rant forum than just go create champions, skins, work on esports, or do a ton of other things high on the priority list.

Riot's viewpoint on balance has clearly developed throughout the years. With the rise of competitive League and massive playerbase on their ranked  queue everyday, balance has probably become something a lot more sophisticated than "people complain about lee sin. ok we nerf now."

I'm just trying to tell the people here that no progress is being made towards contacting Riot by posting here. This is because pretty much 90% of everything said here is garbage and isn't even true. The best we can make of this section is to start meaningful discussion so that maybe Rioters would not just flat out avoid us most of the time.

Obviously it's not going to be easy. There's always new people coming to start spewing dumb arguments because they don't know any better. But there are some regulars that come here often and if those people would say something productive and not pointless, then it would set a good standard for discussion here. And that could lead to a bit more Rioters than the occasional one per month.

And the reds do talk.

But as far as fielding the 9756 Lee Sin QQ threads, they aren't going to bother because there is simply no reason.

Anyone that has been on these boards more than a week either thinks that the people on here know more about balancing a game than professionals, or they have a brain and realize 99% of the people on here haven't got a clue what balance is.

The sheer number of people that still claim that Lee Sin has never been nerfed is enough to prove that many people never bother doing any research before making claims and raging at a company providing them with this game for free.

Well, alright, what's the hardest nerf Lee Sin has ever received? The removal of the 60% attackspeed slow on his cripple?

That definitely knocked him out of top tier, for sure.

When people say "he's never been nerfed", what they really mean is "He's never ***actually*** had his power hit", which is true.

If you were to, for example, nerf the AP scaling on Xin Zhao's dash (excluding the AP xin players), nobody would call that a real nerf. That'd just be Riot trying to cover their ass for an obvious balance problem. If you nerf something that *doesn't actually mean shit for the power of the champion*, you didn't *actually* affect the champion power.

Lee Sin has a kit that does ***WAY*** too much, and is good at doing *all* of what it does. Riot's "nerfs" to Lee Sin in the past have been obvious attempts for them to beat around the bush with the fact that "No, a champion should NOT literally have ***every goddamn thing a jungler could possibly want***".  They need to nerf his *actual power*, not just delay and delay and delay for several *years* until they find some number to hit that doesn't *actually* make him noticeably weaker.

I'm not saying there's not a bunch of idiots without a concept of balance on the forums, what I'm saying is there's *more than enough* evidence supporting the people that have been saying for *three and a half years* Lee Sin is way too versatile and powerful, and that there's enough people who *do* know what they're talking about that the tons of people who don't are basically irrelevant numbers.

Not to mention, as people (almost always in low tiers, but no less a valid point) frequently point out, using your rank as a justification for balancing knowledge is almost an ad hominem argument, as you don't *have* to be Master tier to see an obvious balance problem staring you in the face. Unless you make arguments like "well lee sin gets countered at high tiers", which is untrue as it happens and is the exact reason he gets picked MORE the higher you go up.

Too powerful, I don't think so.

Too versatile, very much so.

Personal opinion, rather than nerfing everything, just tweak him and push him into more of a niche.  Make him either an assassin, a fighter or a tank, don't give him the option to do any of the above while still being relevant late game should he screw up hard.

Versatility is the most powerful thing you can give a champion, so by being too versatile he *is* too powerful.

There's nothing stronger in a game of reaction times and strategy than "I have an answer to any situation I encounter", not to mention the *potential* usefulness in the hands of a skilled player when you have more options is always stronger than a champion with just "raw power" (which is also why "pro" players gravitate to the champions with more situational power than just raw numbers/power, for example picking Orianna over Veigar)

Not to mention, Lee Sin still *does* have a shitload of raw power anyway, and can essentially "turn-on-a-dime" when it comes to his build and do so at any point in the game.

That said, your personal opinion I think is spot-on, and also seems to be what Riot thinks too (though, apparently not enough to get off their asses and DO something about it): A "generalist" champion, as he's been called, *cannot exist in a balanced state* in any game. That should be common knowledge in game design. A generalist character will *always* be too weak or too powerful, and Lee Sin is way too powerful, as he has been for years without people banding together about it: Kinda hard to get a movement going for "this champion is too strong" when he's played more than any other champion and has a bunch of dogmatic fanboys.

Just wanted to make the remark that a champion can be too versatile while simultaneously being not too powerful.  An example would be if a champion were effective in every single role and fit every team comp, but are simply outclassed by specialists.  Versatility offers flexibility, which helps make a champ more resilient, but does not itself give any power.

It's just like you said, a true generalist either crowds out every other option or is entirely weak and thanks to a lack of really meaningful nerfs, Lee has maintained his spot as the safest jungle pick in the game, which really isn't a healthy place for a character who's supposed to be a strong early game bruiser to be.  He needs to be molded into something more specialized rather than being left as a jack of all trades.

I was with you right up until you said to quit it.

If someone refuses to listen and you truly believe your point is important then all you can do is try to rally like minded people and hope that after you kick up enough noise someone will hear you.

Besides Riot claims to pride itself on listening to its community.

However having the vast majority of threads about "balance" boil down to riot doesn't know what they are doing isn't really trying to change someones mind more as its telling someone they are an idiot.

Sure, but the ones that get actually upvoted (aside from the occasional things like that beautiful "fuck mobility creep" thread) are typically very logical, well-written lengthy threads about whatever the ton of people are whining about.

I mean, it's not like "Jesus christ riot stop favoring Lee Sin" is a new topic, it's just usually when the jungle gets reworked and he's "coincidentally" the top dog again and completely avoids changes that it really bubbles up into the hate-wave we have right now.

And I mean c'mon, if someone said "yeah man I really care about how you feel, what's bothering you?" and you told them, and for 3 years they kept doing the *exact same thing* that you begged them for 3 years to please for the love of god **stop doing**... you'd be a bit frustrated too.

Mumu certainly isn't above Lee. He's not even the strongest tank jungler since he got nerfed in the preseason for some reason. Sej is actually stronger than him, but even she would come in at number 7-8. 

I somewhat doubt Rek'sai is no. 4 after the nerfs, she's still a top 5 jungler but she's not above Lee anymore.

It's not like Lee isn't a top tier pick anymore, no matter how you look at it he's number 3 or 4. It's more to do with the length of time he's been there without any significant nerfs. I honestly think most of the community's sick of seeing him in every game, both competitive and regular play by now.

Making him unviable isn't the answer though.
I seriously think he just needs a good push into a niche.
Either make him more of a tank jungler, assassin jungler or fighter jungler, don't give him the ability to go with any of the three while still remaining relevant even if he screwed up hard early game by using his utility to stay relevant.

>Making him unviable isn't the answer though.

I'd say he honestly should have took significant nerfs in S3 and made a priority for a rework.

I don't think his current kit can ever be balanced, it just has too much of everything.

Riot's already shown a reluctance to nerf Lee though, so I doubt anything will happen.

Funny thing, that's what the old Champion Feedback and Item Discussion sections were. You had one good thread for every dozen or so where someone suggested something retarded, complained about something that wasn't really a problem, or bemoaned the loss of something that *was* a problem.

And, so long as we still receive that steady stream of bitching about Lee Sin (and whatever is meta-relevant), Riot really will not take most of what's said in this section seriously. They're *a lot* more interactive with this section than they were with the old forums, but they're taking about as much of the forum input as they did in the past. There's a thing here and there that they take seriously for every multiple-thousand threads that they either ignore or personally say "No" or "Good idea, wrong direction" or something along those lines.

You're also probably right on the 95% of forum members being unable to contribute to an actual discussion. They hang on buzzwords that Riot used in one patch or another video. They complain about something instead of learning to play against it. They see Riot put something on the PBE, then Riot removes it because it didn't do what they wanted, and the players use the most vitriolic things they can say against Riot for deciding the change was going to be a bad idea.
They complain if Riot buffs something.
They complain if Riot nerfs something.
They complain if Riot changes something.
They complain if Riot changes nothing.

It's so rare to find someone who can actually discuss something rationally...

Gnar potentially has 2, and a huge MS boost on procing a % health passive. Then they released Kalista so there is no point of even playing melee tops anymore because late game you can't do your job and reach the ADC.

Then there is the jungle, where Riot refuses to nerf Lee, Jarvan or Vi and instead nerfs all junglers all together. This pretty much made them the only viable junglers atm.

Just because 90% of all feedback is "bad" doesn't mean the forums are useless.

When many people cry about something it can sometimes point towards a genuine issue.

The only people crying about Sona are found on these forums, and there's only a handful of you. A circle jerk isn't required to be based on facts, it just needs to have people bored enough to sustain it.

funny thing, because after all that bitching, Lee sin has been nerfed several times and people still continue because apparently Lee Sin's ability to kick back an immobile ADC is unfair while a million other champions that can do the same thing aren't unfair. /GDlogic

Like really, what do you retards think is even OP about Lee Sin? Absolutely fucking nothing. There is NOTHING he does that somebody else can't do better, which is why he needs so much to even be able to function.

What nerfs? He only got nerfed TWICE without being compensated in the entire 4 years. One nerf was base armor being reduced by like 2 and hp regen reduced by 2 a few patches ago. The other nerf was so he could not longer shield wards. All other nerfs got compensated by adding power somewhere else into his kit.

To be perfectly honest, the history strongly suggests that either there is simply no balance team or they really are a bunch of monkeys in the office room.

If they don't care about what's our say on the balance, why have the "Gameplay & Balance" board tag in the first place, to hear positive praise only? Don't you think that's counter intuitive?

So in the end, you simply made this thread to defend Lee Sin? I am no resident in NA board, granted, but every single time when someone brings up some beliefs about Lee Sin and made it to the Hot topic section, you'll always be there.

> you guys haven't changed anything by making a 1000 threads about this champion

Because we simply can't? We can only hope Riot is actually aware that he has been dominating the game for nearly as long as this game's current age and they really don't see a problem with him? If today let's say Olaf or Urgot is dominating the pro scene, where do you think they will end up? Why not have consistency on what you do Riot?

Feedbacks are meant to be heard, and they even provide us with the space to do so, if you're simply suggesting that we should all quit with the negative feedbacks because we're already unhappy about it for years then I am sorry, you're simply delusional.
Honestly, if the people that worked at riot were competent the game would've been balanced by now.
